intro: [WRONG START] Illcecebrum striatum, commonly known as the creeping morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple, often with a distinctive striped pattern. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas or along stream banks. Due to its rapid growth, it can become invasive in certain environments.
